Reviews.Title: “Very small, cosy hotel with a gorgeous view and friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: Sasha R
Reviews.Content: We stayed with my husband at Zeynep Sultan Hotel in April 2012. You should understand, that this hotel is not a luxury place and you won't find there huge rooms and goldish interiors. Our room (double) and bathroom was very simple and small, but extremely clean. We were absolutely glad with what we have. Breakfast was good: fresh bread, cucumbers, tomatoes, eggs, corn flakes, cheese, salami, olives, apples, tea, coffe, milk, natural yoghurt, cream-cheese, jam, honey, butter. For us - more than enough. You can always order there fresh juice or turkish coffe for a lowest price! View from the breakfast terras is better than at these photos! Staff is very, very friendly! Internet was ok in our room, atleast we watched movies online! The location couldn't be better - on the way to every direction: Sultanahmed (3 min), Eminonu (7 min), Divan Yolu street. All the main attraction are in walking distance. Highly recommend this hotel to unpretentious visitors, who want to live in the very center of Istanbul and who likes small hotels with warm welcome!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: ReneBB
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an ancient building. There is an ancient church under the hotel. It is been excavated at this time,. The rooms are small and basic, the breakfast is plentiful consisting of salami, bread, tomatoes, cucumbers, olives, cereal, coffee and tea. The staff is extremely helpful and will go out of their way to help you find what you're looking for. From the terrace you can see several old mosques and you'll practically be next to Istanbul's main attraction, Aya Sofia. We overlooked small rooms and bathrooms because of the excellent location. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Well located old city hotel: very friendly and helpful and great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Roland and Wend... C
Reviews.Content: I was attracted by the high 'value for money' Tripadvisor rating. I wasn't disappointed. Perfectly comfortable hotel in old Istanbul: Only 5 mins walk from Aya Sofya and an ideal base for seeing the old city. Very friendly staff, with good English. I paid Â£27 per night (single occupancy of a double room, which was quiet and a reasonable size) and that includes a reasonable buffet breakfast. The hotel was clean and the room was well-kitted out, including the bathroom + shower. Wi-fi was free, although I had to sit in the lobby area to connect (but I had worse when I stayed in the new city area for the business part of my trip, in a far more expensive hotel). I've recommended a trip to Istanbul (and this hotel) to all my friends and family and I wouldn't think twice about staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Old City Choice”
Reviews.Author: Glencie
Reviews.Content: If this is your first time in Istanbul, likely you will want to be in the "old city", the area around TopkapÄ± Palace, Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque. This hotel is an excellent choice as all of those are within an easy walk. Also in walking distance are the Grand and Spice Bazaars (well, the latter is in walking distance for me). It's quick walk to either of two stops on the T1 (red) tram - you can connect to/from the M1 (blue) Metro line to the airport easily to/from this tram at Zeytinburnu station. If you want to venture into the hip-and-happening Galata district across the Golden Horn, it's an easy tram ride from either of the two nearby stops. The staff is very friendly and all speak English. If you're lucky enough to be there when the owner is around, he well delight you with tips and stories about the city. I stayed in one of the "cheap" rooms which I found to be perfectly fine for the budget traveler who's too old for hosteling. Small but with all the amenities you'd expect from a typical American motel room. I didn't care for the prayers that are blasted over loudspeakers several times of day being so loud in the room. But then again this is a district with some of the most historic mosques in the world so really every hotel in the area will experience this. The breakfast in the cafe room is generous and with nice views to boot. Overall a great choice in the old part of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located hotel for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: Pennystinker1
Reviews.Content: Perfectly clean, tidy, quiet, lovely staff, nice view of Zeynep Sultan Camii and Hagia Sophia while eating a nice breakfast. We were able to walk to almost everything. It is a very touristic neighborhood, but, really, if you are a tourist interested in seeing historical monuments such as the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Grand Bazaar, Spice Market, Basilica Cistern, Archeologic museum, Topkapi Palace, Bosphorus tours they are all just a short walk away. I was not interested in nightlife, other than walking and seeing the monuments illuminated at night. The neighborhood seemed OK at night, as 2 women alone, while beckoned constantly to shop or eat, we never felt unsafe. We were there in the middle of a snow-filled week, certainly not the tourist season so maybe there is more nightlife in another season. Our room was small, but perfectly adequate. Our bathroom was chilly, but, to be fair I never complained about it so maybe there would have been an easy fix to the problem. Every member of staff were friendly and helpful so I am sure they would have tried. It is also easily reached from the airport by the public transportation which is 4 TL to reach the hotel (2 jetons/tokens). I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “My usual hub for Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: NickRozhdestvensky
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Zeynep 3 times, and every time I get exceptional service: knowledgeable staff, very good command of English. All staff are very helpful, I call this a hub because they can help with just about anything from corrective lenses to empty carboard boxes (if I have extra stuff that does not fit my luggage). Location is superior with tiny old mosque right next door, very quiet and peaceful neighbourhood. 3 minutes to tram station, main means of commuting to elsewhere in this part of town. 5 mnutes from the Cistern, 10 from the Blue Mosque etc. Under the hotel there is a 12-th century church, it literally frms the foundation of the building. Hotel will be happy to give you a tour. It's fascinating - living in such a historical place. Recommendations: book in advance and contact the hotel with your specific room requirements. Cons: just one, the doors between rooms are somewhat leaking sound, but if you are a peaceful sleeper this is not a problem at all.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable place and great location”
Reviews.Author: Marco S
Reviews.Content: This is a simple hotel, very well located in the heart of Sultanhamet (the quarter where most sights are). 5 minutes walk to Aghia Sofia, Blue Mosque, Grand Bazar. 10 minutes walk to EminÃ¶nÃ¼ (harbour for the Bosphorus tour). Tram stop (GÃ¼lhane) 5 minutes away to go towards Taxim Square. The owner (Ibrahim) is a well-travelled man and speaks excellent English. He will be pleased to tell you a lot about his city and the places to see (and to avoid). The staff is very helpful: Iulya and Yussef both speak impeccable English and give you good advice. The twin room we had is quite small and the bathroom is also tiny. Breakfast is simple with tea, coffe, bread, butter and jam, but also fruit and yoghurt. The beds are very simple and the mattresses not that comfortable. Price we paid for a twin room was 79 Euros (during New Year's Eve) per night, which I find rather pricey for a city like Istanbul. Excellent free transfer from airport and back. Very helpful and efficient drivers.

Reviews.Title: “You will never get lost in Istanbul, you will find a friend instead”
Reviews.Author: LouisaAmir
Reviews.Content: The number one reason for us to come back (hopefully in the near future) to Istanbul (and of course this hotel) will be the superb hospitality from the hotel staff. We will never forget the half day free private tour from the staff to the Asian part of Istanbul. We got to see real places where istanbulites hangout, shop and live. We are also grateful for all the tips gave by the them for our wonderful sightseeing in Istanbul. Lastly, of course the hotel condition is good and it's within walking distance to blue mosque, hagia sophia, topkapi palace, other tourist attractions and tram station. Endran and Louisa Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia

Reviews.Title: “very pleasant mini hotel in the heart of the historical part of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: EkaterinaT
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed out stay in the hotel a lot. It was quiet and relaxing. Among advantages the following can be listed: perfect location where from u can easily get to the main sightseeing places; tidy rooms, lovely terrace restaurant overllooking the old mosque; very friendly and helpful staff as well as the manager of the hotel. For the next visit of Istanbul for sure we'll choose Zeynep Sultan hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Below average hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SammyKim
Reviews.Content: I travel extensively and I have high expectations from hotels in the way of cleanliness, efficiency & amenities. This hotel was way below par & I will certainly not be back. While I cannot fault the staff for being kind, helpful & friendly I feel this hotel falls well below par considering their is so much choice of accommodation in Istanbul. I coudn't believe how tiny the room was on arrival so we asked to be moved to a larger room, unfortunately the bigger rooms only have twin beds but decided to take it as it was much bigger. The air-con units in the rooms are from the 70's - they are so loud one can hardly sleep! The rooms are tiny with no space to move around at all! We managed to change our room to a bigger one facing the road. The breakfast buffet is very average with no fruit juice on offer, unless you request it, which is an additional cost. On receiving our bill we were charged in Euros!! Why when we are dealing in Turkish Lira. So we expected to may 2 Turkish Lira we were actually charged 2 Euros - big difference! Had we known we wouldn't have bought juice each morning, what a rip-off! On leaving our passports at reception on arrival, we popped out for lunch, on returning their was no-one at reception & our passports were lying on the counter!!! How irresponsible, anyone could have walked in & taken them. The internet connection in the room is virtually non-existant and continually disappears! We asked for our washing to be laundered & dried before departure, it arrived back in our room damp!! We had to quickly hang it all over the room in order to try and get it dry before packing it into our suitcases. The bathrooms seem to be back to back between rooms and must share ventilation as we were up all night listening to another guest vomiting, it felt like she was in our bathroom!! Finally, we asked for a wake-up call for our airport transfer at 5am. We were called at 5.30am!!! Shocking!! I cannot fault the friendly staff or the cleanliness of the rooms but that's where it ends. Its certainly not worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific little hotel - and relatively inexpensive”
Reviews.Author: Necator N
Reviews.Content: Do come here. Every night, I would come out on the patio and brush my teeth to the view of Aya Sofya - just for the heck of it! So, the location is AMAZING. The hotel itself is very clean, the breakfast is terrific (oh, bread, cheese, fruit, honey, yogurt... And on a patio. And you get to see Aya Sofya the entire time, again). The staff are very helpful and good-humored, and gave us a couple of good pieces of advice. The owner (if you get to meet him) is a very pleasant chatty gentleman with lots of stories to tell. I will stay here again if I come back to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: crystal27
Reviews.Content: We loved it. Nice rooftop restaurant and the location is perfect walking distance to the marina, Grand Bazaar, Spice Market, Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque to name a few. You too will enjoy your stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Another Repeat Visit to the Zeynep Sultan”
Reviews.Author: Austinex
Reviews.Content: This makes the fourth time that I have stayed at the Zeynep Sultan, and each visit confirms my opinion that this is one of the best small hotels in Sultanahmet, the old part of Istanbul. The location is perfect -- just a few minutes from Haghia Sofia, the Blue Mosque, the Underground Cistern, and the Topkapi. Unlike some of the other small hotels in the area, it doesn't require trekking up several steep blocks to get to the hotel. There is an amazing view of Haghia Sofia and the Zeynep Sultan Mosque from the lovely breakfast terrace. The rooms are small, but very comfortable and immaculately clean. But the thing that keeps me returning on each visit to Istanbul is the service. Abe, the owner, is usually on hand at breakfast to help new visitors to Istanbul see all the famous sites that they have come to see, and to chat with returning customers about what they have been doing since their last visit and what they have planned for the current one. Since he grew up in Istanbul, he unfailingly makes good suggestions, whether it is your first visit or your tenth. The rest of the staff is also friendly and helpful, at all times. Try the Zeynep Sultan Hotel -- you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for Budget Traveller”
Reviews.Author: BrianInCalifornia
Reviews.Content: My partner and I were very impressed by this hotel. They provided an excellent breakfast each morning on the upstairs terrace cafe. They had good coffee, fresh vegetables, cold cuts, yogurt, cereal, bread and of course olives. The breakfast hours are quite generous from 7:30 to 11. On our first morning on the terrace we met Abe who was most gracious in helping point out the different sites we shouldn't miss as well as showing us where the local supermarket and pharmacy was located. The rooms were quite clean and tidy as well as the reception area. The hotel provided for our initial transportation from the airport and called for an inexpensive shuttle back to the airport when we left. We stayed one week, then flew south for a week and came back for one night before our flight back home; the hotel staff secured one of our bags that we would not need for our trip south. WiFi internet is available, I was able to connect no problem during our first week, on our final night we were at the far end of the downstairs hallway and not able to connect to the internet, but it's a short walk to reception where you can connect in the sitting area, they actually provide a computer if you need. Laundry is available as well, they charge a nominal fee per load, not garment. The rooms are small as you would expect for the location and budget characteristic of the hotel. You can prepare by packing light and being very organized. There is a closet for you to unpack and keep your bags, a refrigerator with items for purchase and a small area to store your toiletries in the bathroom. The beds are very comfortable, there's cable tv but only a few stations and not much in English, we spent the time calling people using Skype on my smart phone. Since there is so much to see and do in Istanbul, you won't be spending much time in your room anyway. The hotel is practically in the center of everything to see in Sultanamet. It is on a quiet street a block from the busy tramway which will take you to all the big sites. There is a nice view of Aya Sophia from the hotel so you are very close to the Blue Mosque and Topkopi Palace as well, in fact the entrance gate to Topkopi Palace and the Archeological Museum is very very close and it's very easy to ride the tram to Beyoglu/Taksim. Plenty of restaurants in the area, Greens supermarket is very close, there's also a Starbucks if you walk up the tramway toward the Grand Bazaar. The best thing about this hotel is the staff which are super nice and very helpful with any questions you have. The worst thing I guess would be the small room but we quickly got over that, we really enjoyed staying at Zeynep Sultan Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - a stones throw from main sights”
Reviews.Author: kiwitripper11
Reviews.Content: Was lovely to have stayed at this hotel. Abraham and his staff were excellent - very hospitable, and welcoming . Hotel is very well situated, close to tram stop and all the main sites in Sultanamet. Is wonderful to have breakfast on the roof terrace overlooking Zeynep sultan mosque and a great view of Hagia Sophia beyond. Would definitely recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel”
Reviews.Author: robsaw
Reviews.Content: I was somewhat unceremoniously dumped into this hotel after another one decided they didnt have room for me after all and would be sending me elsewhere. While not initially over the moon, the hotel turned out to be a little gem! The hotel is right in the middle of the old city and within a stones throw of the major attractions - indeed the terrace / cafe is dominated by a fantastic view of the amazing Hagia Sophia - be warned though, that you might want to make a note of the hotels telephone number because despite its central location, the maze of one way streets confuse taxi drivers no end - we used to just get dropped off at the blue mosque and walk! My single room was not exactly huge, but a decent size and immaculately clean. Breakfast was a somewhat limited buffet but with enough of a choice to keep most happy and the cafe / terrace also proved a nice place to meet and relax. Staff were friendly and only to happy to offer advice about what to do around the town (importantly they were also happy to help the souvenir hunter get the best price in case they weren't sure of their haggling skills in the Bazaar. All in all I managed to fall squarely on my feet when my first hotel kicked me out. The Zeynep was cheaper and nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Vanna_HR
Reviews.Content: Since I decided to book this hotel based on Trip Advisor's reviews, I also owe a feedback. We stayed in twin bedroom in period 30 March - 03 April 2011. The room was small but I did not think that was a problem since we used it only for sleep and spent the whole day sightseeing. Bathroom was also small but functional. Seeing other hotels, we appreciated that our was in a quite street, with not trams or cars or tourist groups, therefore we get an excellent sleep! The mosk is near hotel, but in Istanbul it is impossible to find a hotel that is far away from the mosk, I am writing this because of the dawn's call to pray. It was not so loud at all and it did not harm our sleep. Breakfast was ok, cheese, salami, butter, jam, milk, coffee, apple, tomatoes itd. It is not a breakfast that we are used to in bigger hotels, but I did not expect more than I paid-so I was satisfied as well. The hotel is a few minutes walk from tram station, Aya Sofia, Blue mosk, Basilica cistern, Hippodrome, Topkapi palace, Archaeological museum...it all saves your time if your are in Istanbul only for a few days. Hotel staff was also very nice and ready to give advise on everything we asked for. In order to easy approach the hotel from Ataturk airport take a metro and exit at Zeytinburnu, where you should take a tram, and exit at Gulluhan station. When get out of the tram, turn back to the direction you arrived from, take second street right, and than second street left....in the middle of the small street is Zeyten Sultan hotel. We also appreciated a one way free transport to or from Ataturk airport since we stayed more than 3 nights!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location but very small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Jimpepe
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the area of Sultanhamet very close to Hagia Sophia and all the other monuments in the area.It is also 3 minutes away on foot from the tram station so you can get anywhere you want with no trouble.It is located in a very quite road so you can enjoy your sleep.The service was friendly but the rooms were extremely small.The breakfast was minimal (only coffee and milk,no juice).I guess the rooms could be cheaper but for a few days(we stayed for four nights) it's fine.

Reviews.Title: “Come back? Sure, any time!”
Reviews.Author: Hellmont
Reviews.Content: Situated in the middle of all that's worth seeing this little hotel offers the most friendly hospitableness. The staff is helpful in any situation and the owners provide you with all information you need for your stay. Couldn't be any better!

Reviews.Title: “A great little haven in the middle of everything”
Reviews.Author: Kulchershok
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to us and I can see why: all the staff were friendly, most especially the owner who took the time and trouble to give us great tips about Istanbul (in fantastic English!) and even showed us the church beneath the building! The hotel has admittedly small rooms, but who spends their holiday in their hotel room?? There's a great terrace and everything you need is nearby. I was particularly delighted to have the most painless Wi-Fi connection ever! The only small niggle was that we weren't warned that the airport shuttle fare had to be in cash, instead of added onto our card, which basically cleaned us out of Turkish Lira, but aside from that, can't really fault it...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, and a very comfortable stay.”
Reviews.Author: cammerayguy
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this delightful hotel for 3 nights. Firstly the location is perfect - literally only a block from the tourist center of Sultanahamet but on a quiet back lane away from all the noise. Such a quiet back lane that our taxi from the airport was reluctant to drop us at the door. We were woken on our first morning before dawn by the calls from the minaret right next door to the hotel...but that is a small price to pay for being in the heart of the city. Our room appeared to be a little on the small size, but it turned out there was plenty of space to empty our two suitcases. The shower was cramped but by the end of our stay we stopped banking our head on the show fitting! Reception was friendly and very helpful, including arranging a shuttle for us early on our final morning. And the internet PC in the tiny foyer was very useful (when one works out how to adapt to a Turkish keyboard!) The included breakfast was varied, and taken on the terrace with views of Hagia Sophia. In summary, highly recommended without reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: asagao
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this hotel, and it remains a good value for the money. Though prices in Istanbul have certainly taken an upward spiral, Zeynep Sultan has kept its rates affordable to those with modest budgets. (Our double room, with breakfast cost USD 107/night). Yes, the rooms are small and sparely furnished, but the price is right. More important, the reception staff remains warmly and efficiently welcoming. The owner himself is often on the premises, chatting up the guests and giving out welcome tips to travelers. There are signs of wear and tear on the furnishings and linen, and the rooms were not as immaculately cleaned as before, but all in all, nothing major to complain about. (The leak in our shower booth was fixed promptly.) The staff arranges tours and visits to landmarks. Turkish baths, etc. on request. Oh, and the hotel offers free pickup service from the airport. I

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, location & service”
Reviews.Author: hncworldtraveller
Reviews.Content: I & my wife, along with 2 other couples, just stayed 3 nights at this small boutique hotel in Istanbul. Its first strong point is its location: being a couple of blocks away from Ayia Sofia/Topkapi and the Basilica Cistern. It is only 200 meters from the tramway and within walking distance to all the other attractions in Sultanamhet. Its second strong point is its great service and hospitality, especially the owner, mr. Ibrahim, who went out of his way to help us, when we were caught in a small panic. The remaining staff is also great, with a more than good breakfast, to be had on the rooftop with close views of Ayia Sofia's minarets. Internet is free, however there is only one station. We can wholeheartedly recommend this lovely hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless location”
Reviews.Author: sassyjem
Reviews.Content: Whilst obviously not being a 5* hotel, this really is a super little place for the money. Yes, the rooms are small, particularly the bathroom so if you are looking for luxury this probably wouldnt suit. I chose this hotel because of its location to the main tourist attractions and was not disappointed. Ideally situated a few minutes walk from all the main attractions, yet away from the hustle and bustle so a quiet nights sleep was possible ( apart from the early morning call to prayer but you would get that anywhere!) Breakfast as stated in earlier reviews was basic but by no means inedible. Probably would get a little fed up with it though if staying longer than a few days. Ask to see the church underneath the hotel...it is amazing!!! If you want to save a good deal of money on airport transfer take the train from the airport to zeytinburnu then pick up a tram to sultanahment....perfect and only worked out to Â£3.00 for my partner and I one way!!! Enjoy your trip - Istanbul really is beautiful....:-)

Reviews.Title: “perfect position charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: kernowboycornwallUk
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in this hotel and found it to be a very pleasant experience.The rooms are a little small but had all mod cons,the staff are top notch and very helpful with lots of local knowledge.The roof terrace is wonderful with splendid views and the geographical situation is perfect.When we return to Istanbul we know where we will stay.The Zeynep Sultan Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location”
Reviews.Author: Cambridgian
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very well located, convenient to the main tourist attractions but also the tram line and the bazaar area. Staff is friendly, available and very knowledgeable. We got excellent recommendations for dinner and helpful advice about transportation to remote parts of town. Rooms and bathrooms are clean and functional but small, even for 2 persons. We were 3, and a folding bed had been added to the room. There was no space left to open and store the luggage, and this left a negative impression. I understand not all rooms have the same size, make sure to confirm a larger room if you are 3. The covered terrace where breakfast is served is very pleasant; it can also be used during the day (as there is no space in the rooms !), snacks and drinks are available there. Free wireless service worked well in the lobby and on the terrace, but not in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, location and value”
Reviews.Author: BarryandJackie
Reviews.Content: So, what else do you want.... at this price? First, the service was great. The folks couldn't have been nicer and more helpful along a number of dimensions. They were terrific with directions and also helped four of us book a private van to the airport at the last minute. The location is great. Very convenient to the "old city" attractions but off the main road so that the venue is relatively quiet. The breakfast is fine but would become boring, as most do, if you stay more than a few days (we were there for three nights). The terrace rooftop is very nice with places to sit both inside and outside, and it is available for relaxation and beverages in the afternoon and into the evening. Wireless connections throughout the building and a PC to share in the lobby. What's not so great? Well, the bathrooms are tiny and the shower is just for standing up, but I did appreciate the hot water (plenty of it) and good water pressure. The room was bigger than some we've stayed in this area and smaller than others in the same area but who spends all that much time in the room, any ways. Good closet space if you have lots of luggage. I would have appreciated a few carpets on the floor but the floors were clean and the room was serviced daily.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL AND LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: UKR1
Reviews.Content: I would thank all the staff for their hospitality and accomodating us at a very short notice we gave,it was a last minute decision to come to Istanbul. We had a great stay in this lovely family run hotel.Great location and yet tucked away from all the noises you would expect in big cities. very clean and tidy and great breakfast...each day certainly will recommend you. next time we promiss to book well ahead Thank you Mr Emre

Reviews.Title: “Basic rooms , fantastic location !”
Reviews.Author: sipenholz
Reviews.Content: Good location and very helpful reception . Rooms very basic but clean , tiny bathroom/shower . Breakfast , served in small but nice rooftop-garden , okay ... poor quality of coffee and marmalade . Free Internet . Laundry service could be better ...... only washing !

Reviews.Title: “Great value and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: terranaut
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for four nights. This a clean but no-frills hotel that suited our needs. We wanted a place to relax, close enough to the all the sites but within our budget. The staff was very friendly and helpful and the location is excellent. It's right in the Old City, near a metro stop and in walking distance to many tourist attractions but at the same time the street is quiet, void of traffic and while we were there hassling touts and merchants that you would find in other parts of Sultanahmet. Our room and bathroom was a little small but suited our needs. Rooms are clean and beds are comfortable. The hotel was pretty empty when we were there (off-season) it seems that the walls are pretty thick and we didn't hear a lot of noise. Hotel is located near a mosque so the call to prayer might bother some although we didn't notice it. Internet was a nice bonus. Although it's the same everyday, there is a variety of things to eat for breakfast on the roof, enjoying views of the Aya Sofia. The hotel can arrange transportation to the airport, which we didn't take since it was so close to a metro line.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: sumone8
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our return to Istanbul from the Mediterranean coast at the recommendation of friends. The location could not be more perfect-- walking distance to all the sights and yet tucked in a quiet street off the main track. Easy access to the metro (we also took the metro to and from the airport--EASY and very economical!). As you'd expect, the rooms are smaller in size, but clean and efficiently organized. The breakfast on the terrace was lovely--nice to get above the city streets and to get the views of ancient sights. The owner, Abe, was very hospitable. We enjoyed his take on the changes in Istanbul (returned after many years abroad) and his experience converting his family home into a hotel. He was the epitome of Turkish hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “We couldn't have stayed in a more perfect place - we loved it!”
Reviews.Author: ROSY18
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel -it's in the most amazing location within walking distance to all the major sites, but so quiet and peaceful. The staff are friendly and very helpful, the rooms are simply furnished - very comfortable and immaculate. The breakfast terrace is great and the view is stunning - what a find - we were thrilled at our choice of hotel and couldn't have been happier - we didn't want to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Cinnamoncyndi
Reviews.Content: This was a fantastic location - close to Tourist attractions, and food. No need to take transportation to major attractions - most are all within walking distance. The Staff was Amazing, helpful, and friendly. Our trip here was made better because of the location and staff of this hotel. Bravo - well done Zeynep Sultan Hotel. Thank you for the wonderful memories you gave us while we vacationed in Turkey !

Reviews.Title: “Turkish Hospitality at its Best”
Reviews.Author: jma1445
Reviews.Content: Thanks to the great staff we felt completely welcomed and at home at the Zeynep. They have a great terrace, and a very nice breakfast spread with hard boiled eggs, cheeses, olives, tomato and cucumber, cereal, etc. The rooms are small and basic, but extremely clean, and the showers have great water pressure with no shortage of hot water. Ask for one of their larger rooms, and if you are concerned about being woken by the call to prayer just ask for one of the quieter rooms. But, we didn't mind being woken....isn't that all apart of the experience of traveling in a Muslim country? The best amenity was the excellent service. The owner even walked us over to the pharmacy to help us get medicine for our cold. They will also give you the best advice about where to eat and where to shop to get the best deals. We liked our stay so much that we actually came back and stayed 3 more nights. We would absolutely stay here again! Thanks Abe, Yusef, Duran, Emre and all the staff! We hope to see you all again soon.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel -- again!”
Reviews.Author: Austinex
Reviews.Content: This makes the 3rd time that I have stayed at the Zeynep Sultan. Each time I have received the same warm service and hospitality provided by the staff. Yes, the rooms are small and the bathrooms even smaller, but everything is impeccably clean and in good condition. Most of the hotels in Sultanahmet have breakfast terraces on the roof, but few of them are as lovely as the one at the Zeynep Sultan, or have quite as spectacular of a view.

Reviews.Title: “super choice in the heart of the old monuments of the city!”
Reviews.Author: divalover
Reviews.Content: We stayed 15 days in hotel Zeynep Sultan and only have good words for the hotel. Very helpful staff, especially Yusuf who helps with every information you would want about trips,etc. Now 15 days is a longer time than most tourists in Istanbul do. Therefore you would need a good room and a good bathroom for such a period. The rooms are not very big as also isn`t the bathroom. But everything you need is there ,it`s not damaged and kept very clean every day! Very reasonably prized too. We remember fondly the big hotel`s cat DeeBee almost all the time sleeping ,exept when there a slice of saucage in front of his nose....Not too many people know that the hotel is a restaured very old building and that`s why the rooms cannot be made larger as the building is monumental, built actually on a church, which can be seen in the basements when asked.We loved that the rooms are very quiet compared with the noise and sounds of that extremely busy city. All tourist attractions are within walking distance : Aya Sophia you can already view from the rooftop restaurant of the hotel. Blue mosque, Cisterns,Topkapi, Grand Bazar and Egyptian Bazar are very close by. We gladly return whenever we visit Istanbul again. Greetings from Holland

Reviews.Title: “Bare Bones Essentials for the Site Seeing Traveler”
Reviews.Author: SampleTheCulture
Reviews.Content: This is a reasonably priced boutique hotel in a good location. We stayed here for a few nights because we planned on site seeing most of the time and just wanted a hotel to sleep and get breakfast at. The place is great for that purpose. No frills accommodations with a free breakfast (love the simits) right in the heart of Sultanahment Istanbul The people are very nice and helpful and the rooms have a fairly clean bed, a tv and a decent bathroom. There is a computer with internet in the lobby for free guest use. Warning â€“ you will hear â€˜Call to prayerâ€™ very early in the morning because the Hagia Sofia is right next to it. Overall if serves itâ€™s purpose well as a lower cost, clean enough, decent breakfast in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location to many attrations”
Reviews.Author: Rob1502
Reviews.Content: A small family run hotel, where nothing was to much trouble, the bathroom was smallish but more than adequate. The breakfast/Bar had both indoor and outdoor areas with wonderful views, particulary of the Aya Sophia. Comp internet a bonus. Good shoping in the local area and good restaurants of all price stuctures.

Reviews.Title: “Don't worry, be happy))”
Reviews.Author: Cherepashka
Reviews.Content: Very nice and clean hotel with perfect location and beautiful views. The service was good, althogh I have some notes about their manager) The manager promised to help me with ferry+train tickets to Izmir, but suddenly simply forgot about that and went to check that out when we have already arrived to Istanbul. As soon as it was a high season for those tickets, we had to travel by bus. Apart from that, by mistake the manager reserved the rooms for us for June, not for July; so when I got the message by e-mail in June about "no show-up event", I had to call them ASAP. Fortunately, they have found that my original request was about July and the problem was solved) However, the staff of the hotel was very nice and helpful, espesially Yusuf Kirgiz, who repeated "Don't worry, be happy" several times, when I was espesially nervious.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean and basic”
Reviews.Author: kiki-cukoo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in Sultanahmet, which is the touristy area of Istanbul, and is close (5 minute walk) from Blue Mosque, Spice Bazaar, Grand Bazaar, so good area to walk around. Rooms are small, but everything is clean, air con, tv, minibar and thats about it. No safe in room (perhaps they have one in reception?) Free wireless internet through the hotel which is great. There is a mosque literally next door, and they all have speakers on them, so yes, the call to prayer is loud (and happens several times a day), but this didn't bother me, in fact, I like it, but if you're a light sleeper/don't enjoy that sort of thing then perhaps not the place for you. I would recommend. Good price and great location.

Reviews.Title: “So good, we went back on our return leg through Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: laidbacknz
Reviews.Content: Taking into account the prices and size of most hotels in Istanbul we thought this was great value. The room wasn't very big, and the bathroom even smaller but it more than fit us and our backpacks. Was fine for us who were out sightseeing and needed a comfy quiet place to sleep. The key things for us were double glazing so we didn't hear the call to prayer and so could sleep off our jet lag, the location was excellent, the rooms were clean and the staff friendly. Only negatives were there was no character to the rooms and breakfast was average and exactly the same every day.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: azurita
Reviews.Content: This hotel is simply perfect. Don't expect luxuries but for a reasonable price you will be hosted in an exceptionally well managed hotel. Rooms and bathroom (the latter a bit small, though, maybe a standard in Istanbul) are very clean and hotel staff is very helpful. We had no problems at all and they help us with all our needs. Breakfast could be improved a bit with more variety but in the end having breakfast in the terrace in the sunny morning facing Aya Sofia was superb. Location is also perfect, just a few steps from Aya Sofia and Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace...but the neighbourhood is very quiet, You can visit Istanbul on foot really. I would definitely stay there again. By the way, be careful not to step on the nice hotel cat!

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite hotel in Turkey!”
Reviews.Author: drpvfx
Reviews.Content: This little hidden gem of a hotel was the star of our month-long stay in Turkey. Emre and his staff are easily the most helpful hotel employees I've ever dealt with. Emre himself walked with me to a camera shop and negotiated me a much better price, which was more than any hotel owner has ever done for me. It was a wonderful introduction to the hospitality of the Turkish people, and I can't recommend this hotel highly enough! It's walking distance to almost every big attraction in Istanbul, they have free wifi and internet, and a great free breakfast as well. I will absolutely come back here next time I'm in town, and I would recommend it to anyone! Thanks Emre, Yusuf, Abraham, and everyone else! We had an amazing time!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, quiet, and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: greengobbler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally located in the Sultanahmet area of Istanbul, and is extremely close to the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, tram line, and many other tourist attractions. The hotel is quiet (except for the early morning call to prayer from the mosque next door), the staff will give you information on nice things to do in the city (and they aren't promoting anything in particular, it seems), and the breakfast on the terrace overlooking the Hagia Sophia is lovely.

Reviews.Title: “So close we felt we could touch the mosques”
Reviews.Author: mamnnp
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one week at this budget hotel. It is very clean-room and bath. It is right in the heart of attractions (Aya Sophia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi palace) you would want to see and down thw street from the tram line. The staff are fluent in English, always at the desk and very knowledgeable about sights and schedules. Finally the hotel has internet access (not just wi-fi-- but a computer you can use to check weather, restaurants, email).

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, comfortable facilities, accommodating staff”
Reviews.Author: Car0linian
Reviews.Content: I really loved this place. I've stayed in Istanbul many times and this hotel really rates right up there with the best all around values to be had in this city. First of all, you will die when you see that the hotel is literally at the foot of Hagia Sophia- it is backlit at night. Location could not be any better, period. The owner explained to me his philosophy- the hotel is in an old historic building protected from major renovations to the structure by ordinances aimed at preserving the architectural elements of the old city. so basically this is why the rooms and baths are somewhat small. These comments in the reviews are correct. But it isn't a cramped, uncomfortable type of small. It's more of a no-space spared, scandinavian-style 'IKEA' type of configuration. Built-in furniture consoles that maximize useable space, etc. It didn't bother me at all and I was there for two weeks. The europeans there seemed to have no problem with this as the norm in EU is to have smaller rooms. US guests just be aware that this is not going to be spaciousness on a US standard. You won't need it anyway because you'll be out enjoying the city and not sitting around the hotel all day. Breakfast is the typical turkish fare, i.e. a light assortment of meats, cheeses, yogurt, olives, oranges, cold cereal, tea/instant coffee etc. perfectly adequate. but if you have to commit the ultimate sacrilege there is a McDonald's down the street ;) Employees at the hotel are very nice and helpful. At the price you simply cannot beat the Zeynep Sultan hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, central, comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Frazella
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is so central you can walk absolutely everywhere. The staff where very welcoming, friendly and helpful and made our stay very memorable especially the resident "DB". My daughterâ€™s favorite part of our holiday was our hotel. I would like to thank the staff for coming to my rescue after half way to the airport I realized I left our passports at the hotel. Thanks for a great holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Small but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: wharton1Trencin
Reviews.Content: The Room- The hotel room we had was very clean and tidy with TV and fridge, dont expect modern designer decor but perfectly adequate. The bathroom was also very clean with a shower that had great water pressure and plenty of hot water even at peak morning times. The bed was comfortable. The only issue with the room was the general size. very small room and extremly small bathroom and shower. If you are staying for a weekend of site seeing like we did, this should be no issue The service- Staff all friendly and helpful. Free internet downstairs is also useful. Best member of staff has to be the lazy cat. always asleep or angling for cuddles. The location- PERFECT. Right in the middle of everything and all within walking distance. The only thing to watch out for is the local resteraunts and bars are very expensive 2.50 euro for a Turkish coffee and 1.50 euro for a cup of tea the size of a shot of whiskey in the place next door. Be warned.......... The food- We had breakfast at the hotel everyday and although basic and repetitive- bread, cold meats, tea cofee and boiled eggs was adequate, filing and served on clean plates with great views of aya sofia from the terrace. Overall- Good value for money hotel in a great location for seeing the sites of the city

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: me14
Reviews.Content: I was really impressed when we got to the hotel as it is clean and very well located near Topkapi with a lovely breakfast terrace but the fact that I had some English money stolen from our room means I wouldn't stay here again. It was only five pounds but it left me disappointed and a little uneasy for the rest of the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dmansix
Reviews.Content: We (wife and I) stayed here for 9 nights. It's clean, comfortable, and near every site you would want to visit in Istanbul. The rooms are not carpeted, though for us that was not a problem (you can see how clean or dirty your floor is). The bathrooms are small but clean (as long as I could shower, use the toilet, and brush my teeth, what's there to complain about?). The breakfast provided by the hotel was satisfactory. It provided plenty of fuel for the day. The staff at the hotel is also excellent. They pick you up from the airport (free of charge). They also speak English and are ready to help you plan your day, recommend sites to see, or make dinner reservations for you. In particular, the hotel owner actually ate breakfast with the guests every morning. He's quite knowledgeable of the area and all the best places to see or to dine. Better than most American hotels (I travel for work frequently).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly welcome”
Reviews.Author: Thenumber
Reviews.Content: We were met at the airport - great in Istanbul's frantic traffic - and taken to this oasis of calm in the heart of the Old City. The rooms were clean and comfortable, the breakfast simple, but plentiful and the welcome was friendly and helpful. Just five minutes walk from the entrance to the Topkapi and less than ten minutes stroll from The Blue Mosque. The Gulhane tram stop is perhaps five minutes walk down hill and there are dozens of restaurants within easy walking distance too. An ideal location for exploring Istanbul on foot and tram.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Family Run Riad!!!”
Reviews.Author: agoraphile
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week. The owner's nephew picked me up from the airport. They were wonderful hosts and really helpful. The owner was gracious and really helpful, whether it was making recommendations for how to spend my time or helping me navigate. I will definitely stay here again the next time I'm in Istanbul, which can't come soon enough!

Reviews.Title: “A great choice”
Reviews.Author: deveinn
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because of the reviews I've read in in TripAdvisor and it was really a great hotel. The best thing about this hotel is it's LOCATION. I rate it as an above average hotel putting in mind the room rate and the same level hotels. I strongly recommend this hotel if you don't already know your hotel in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very sleepy cat!”
Reviews.Author: SydneyWarey
Reviews.Content: Excellent stay at this hotel - extremely convenient location - everything within walking distance and a great view of Aya Sofia from the terrace. The staff were very friendly and accommodating. Very friendly cat (when it was awake!).

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location”
Reviews.Author: watersoakedcar
Reviews.Content: A great deal for the money. The hotel is really conveniently located; just steps from Saint Sophia. It's got a rooftop deck from which you have an amazing view of that spectacular building. They give you free breakfast, which, while not the most exciting thing you've ever had, really isn't bad. The rooms are small, but clean. You probably won't spend a ton of time there, though, so the lack of bells and whistles won't really bother you. Also, the hotel is on a pretty quiet street. People walk by at night, but I didn't experience much noise, certainly nothing to keep you awake. The best thing, though, is the location. You're in the heart of Sultanahmet, located close to tons of amazing sites.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Clean”
Reviews.Author: LondonCalling2006
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Zeynep Sultan Hotel on our last night in Turkey. The hotel picked us up at the airport free of charge and the staff were very friendly and accomodating. Our rooms were on the first floor and as other previous reviewers have stated you could definitely hear a lot through the walls and we didn't get much light. However, that said, the water pressure was the best here out of all the hotels we stayed in during our trip to Turkey and everything was very clean.

Reviews.Title: “a very nice experience in the heart of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Vocalia
Reviews.Content: The Zeynep Sultan is a cosy and warm hotel in a very nice and quite location in the heart of Sultanahmet, very close to Topkapi Palace, the Blue Mosque and to Aya Sofia. The rooms are a bit small but absolutely clean and very comfortable. The owner and his staff (included the big red&white cat waiting for us at the reception) made us feel at home. They have been really kind and helpful with us. We strongly recommend this hotel to small groups and families.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - thoroughly enjoyed stay!”
Reviews.Author: PamEqualsCool
Reviews.Content: The Zeynep Sultan Hotel was perfect. It was incredibly clean. It had a perfect location in the historic Sultanhamet area (steps away from the Blue Mosque and the Hagia Sophia), and the service was impeccable. Just some examples of the amazing service: - A driver from the hotel picked us up from the airport free of charge. - A hotel employee gave us a ride to a local Turkish Bath one evening. - We enjoyed a free breakfast from the hotel's rooftop every morning. By the end of the trip, the employees had become our friends. They even took us out for dinner one evening. It was really nice to feel so at home so far from home. Definitely stay here if you can!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: space_student
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a fantastic value! We paid 59 euro per night for a double room, and it was worth every penny. The location is among the best in Istanbul - few minutes walk to all the major attractions (Aya Sofia, Blue Mosque, etc) and 2 blocks away from a tram stop, yet tucked away on a quiet street away from the crowds and the noise. The hotel staff were very friendly, accommodating, and helpful. We were shown several room at check-in and were allowed to choose. We picked a relatively large room overlooking the Zeynep Sultan mosque. The prayer call was rather loud in the mornings, but we slept through it most days. As other reviewers mentioned, the view from the terrace is amazing, especially at night. The breakfast was There is also a computer in the lobby with free internet, which was a big plus.

Reviews.Title: “"Value"? Nope”
Reviews.Author: madqdog
Reviews.Content: Great location, terrific views from the roof top terrace, great price, amd some staff quite attentive. So what's not to like? First, this place is very noisy; were street noises not enough, there is NO insultation (did Marc Cohn write "Paper Walls" while staying here?). But the issue that placed me into orbit was the wonderful sign posted in the lobby for smokers to be considerate of others... while the clerk chain-smoked less than 3 meters away. Istanbul is a smoking city and smoke-free zones are non-existent, but the Zeynep makes a mockery of appealing to non-smokers. If you're deaf and smoke heavily, the Zeynep is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: dabsydney
Reviews.Content: Small, comfortable hotel. Clean, good location, friendly staff. Ask for a room on the upper floor as ground floor rooms get little light. Also, don't trust restaurant recommendations - not v good.

Reviews.Title: “Good Basics - 1st time in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: JRMountain
Reviews.Content: This is a good economy hotel. Do not expect luxury but expect a clean room with average service. The staff will accomodate and help you with your day to day requests. Breakfast is simple and basic but good. The owner took me down to the church underneath the hotel so pls ask. Quite solid walls. It has an excellent location within the old city and nice roof deck overlooking Haguia Sophia

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: SeattleSupersonic
Reviews.Content: Can't beat the location -- about two blocks from the Aya Sofia, another block to the Blue Mosque, on a quiet side-street. You can see the Aya Sofia directly from the rooftop deck. Rooms are clean, management and staff is very helpful and knowledgeable. Ask the manager to show you the 3rd Century church under the hotel building...

Reviews.Title: “OK option for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: justanytourist
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for almost a week. The location is great for getting around and everything is very clean. Rooms have an okay size which is not obvious in this city and are freshly renovated. The staff is very friendly which is not necessarily the case for the owner. He became extremely unfriendly when I enquired about longer stay discounts (2 doubles for 5 nights) especially since I was offered a higher price than was advertised for a double through Expedia. Compared to other hotels I stayed in (eg Sebnem) I think you can get better value for money.

Reviews.Title: “really nice but not a 5”
Reviews.Author: DSZ
Reviews.Content: Clean, friendly, great location, but just not a 5. We had a really nice stay there, but there is nothing that sets it apart from many other places we stayed for a similar price, not to say I wouldn't recommend it, it's just not a 5. One thing that wasn't so great was how thin the walls seemed to be. If you do stay at ZSH or near there, I recommend going to a restaurant called Omars (sp?). Good stuff, relatively inexpensive. Sit on the top floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Campbellsoup
Reviews.Content: The Zeynep Sultan was everything the TripAdvisor promised and more. We were there on the first and second day of Ramadan and the call to prayer was amazing to watch from the rooftop. Abraham made us coffee and drew us maps of must see places to visit and eat. That is what made the place extra special to us. Sultan, the young lady at the desk was adorable and helpful. Don't pay for taxi to airport. Ask her to book you the 4 Euro transfer. You can book it yourself down the block, but for the same price they will come to the hotel and bring your luggage up the hill to the meeting point for you. The hotel is just around the corner from the Surceki tram stop. Get off there and follow the tracks around the corner to the street sign that will show you the way. I loved Istanbul and will stay here again if I am lucky enough to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: mokaboy
Reviews.Content: Wonderful little hotel very close to the Haghia Sophia and the amazing Palace. Most importantly, the owner is extremely helpful - make sure he shows you the 3rd Century church in the basement!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: RichardSCalgary
Reviews.Content: The Zeynep Sultan is a small hotel on a quiet pedestrian street, just steps from all the major sights. It had everything we were looking for on our second visit to Istanbul: good location, quiet street, cleanliness, good breakfast, airport transfers, friendly and attentive staff, and personalized attention. The highlights of our stay included breakfast and drinks on the beatiful patio overlooking Haggia Sophia and a visit to the partially excavated church (300 A.D.) located directly beneath the foundations of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast on the terrace, over looking the Haggia Sophia”
Reviews.Author: Dedris
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are familiar with Istanbul, having stayed and travel through this fine exotic and beautiful city. The standard of hotel rooms can very and does not always reflect the price of the room or the location or the history of the building. So based on the 'Trip Advisor' reviews, we booked three nights B&B. We were late on arriving - this did not cause the least problem. My Turkish is poor - this was similarly, not a problem as the management spoke perfect English. We were offered a ground floor room for our first night, but would be moved on nights two and three to second floor room with a better view, a minor inconvenience. The first room was dark, but we new we would be moving. The second room was light but very small. You pay your money and you make your choice. In this respect the hotel was excellent value NL 79 per night. I have no complaints. The hotel is new, modern and well run. Breakfast was taken on the terrace, a quite and pleasant area, with lovely view of the Haggia Sophia,. To sum up. The standard of the rooms was very high, clean, well equipped and modern, but very small. Everything worked, clean towels and complimentary toiletries. The location is perfect so central and within 500 yds of all the main sights and restaurants. The staff are efficient, helpful and very pleasant. This is a hotel that matches the reviews and is worth considering.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet quality”
Reviews.Author: gogleddcymru
Reviews.Content: This Hotel has all the qualities -quiet - welcoming - comfortable - clean - close to the old city and all the main sites. Just a fifteen minute walk to the restuarants on the Galata Bridge + the spice market. We were able to seek advice from reception on trips - the sites - shuttle bus to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure and get your reservation etched in stone...”
Reviews.Author: PhilHelmuth
Reviews.Content: You had better confirm your reservation in stone with these guys, lest you find yourself in my shoes. I can't comment on the hotel itself, but I can comment on the hoops required to book with them. I ended up getting a good rate with this hotel for one night on the way out of Istanbul, arriving from Cappadocia. I had read the reviews and was happy. It was short-lived. I originally called the hotel to make the reservation (well ahead of time) but after I provided my information, they insisted that I email them to make the reservation. Ok, so I emailed them all my information and they emailed me back to say everything was set. They requested that I email them once again to confirm confirm confirm the booking. So, I emailed them again to confirm my previous phone call and email. Things were starting to get complicated. About a week later, I receive a rather odd email suggesting that my initial email was not received properly, but that I did not have to take any action as it was still received. I should point out that in almost 10 years of using my hotmail account, I have never received such an email. Ok fine, but I decided to email them AGAIN anyway. The response I got said that they were fully booked. Curious. Annoying. I had initially received a special rate and the cinic in me wondered (as Istanbul became surprisingly abnormally busy while I was there and hotels filled up) whether a higher rate was quoted and paid by a walk-in guest. My paranoia was echoed by a few locals who explained to me that this was a somewhat common practice amongst some hotels--reservations made at lower discount rates dissappear if hotels fill up and full-rate rooms can be sold. Not that I can definitively say this was the case, but I question why, after a phone call and at least one email, they didn't at least try and get in touch with me before they gave my room away. Not even an email? Curious. At least they were very polite whilst I was being screwed over. Anyhow, just let this review serve as a warning to make sure you are triple-confirmed in stone before you leave for your travels. I had to waste about two hours trying to book another hotel, while I was traveling. Pain in the ash. The story ends well though--I got a room in the AND HOTEL which, in my opinion, has the most stunning patio and view of Istanbul. I would stay in the AND HOTEL just for the view of Sultanahmet. The service there was excellent and the location was right smack in the middle of Sultanahmet. A hearty breakfast was included, again with the awesome view. And the AND was cheaper than the Zeynep too! Go figure...

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: frankfurtermadchen
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a small comfortable space in a very convenient location. It's located in a quiet alley/one-way street next to a small mosque. It's within walking distance to many attractions: Gulhane Park, Topkapi Palace, Classical Archaeological Museum, Ancient Oriental Works Museum, Aya Sofia (Hagia Sofia), the beautiful Sultan Ahmet Camii (Blue Mosque), and Basilica Cistern. The hotel seems like it's family run, and the owner is frequently around to greet guests and offer transportation or sightseeing advice. When you check in they request your passport to register with the police (which is standard procedure in Istanbul). The rooms are small but very clean and comfortable. Ours had a queen size bed with nightstands , a small table/cabinet, small refridgerator, large armoire with drawers inside, and a medium sized wall mounted television. There was also a large mirror and a large window overlooking the deck/breakfast area. The bathrooms are also very tiny, but clean and modern. Small pedestal sink with mirror, toilet, and shower only (no tub in our room, not sure about others). Shower had great water pressure and temp consistancy. It is very narrow so it may not be suitable for those with larger body types. Also note that there wasn't much space to put toiletries as there really wasn't any counterspace at all. Sounds pretty cramped doesn't it? If you're looking for a hotel to lounge around in for many hours of the day, this one probably won't be your first pick. We didn't want to be tempted to do this so this hotel was perfect, but we did feel relaxed and comfortable at the end of each day when we returned. Breakfast is included with the room and the patio/deck area where it is served is typical of the area and has gorgeous views both during the day and at night. You can see the Aya Sofia while drinking a cup of coffee. There is a glass enclosed indoor area where the buffet style breakfast is served and additional seating outside if you wish. It's a nice area to mingle with the owner and other guests! Breakfast is simple but filling. Coffee (instant), Tea, sweet rolls, crusty rolls, cheese, butter, jam, a few coldcuts, hot boiled eggs, olives,sliced cucumbers, tomatoes, and fruit are the usual selections. Some things to be aware of -throughout Istanbul the mosques sing out a call to prayer several times a day. This can be heard everywhere in the city but particularly in this area as there is a mosque directly next to the hotel. Some people found this bothersome, we found it rather beautiful and soothing. -the hotel offers transportation to and from the airport at a cost of 35euro. I believe it's cheaper to hire a taxi @ approx 20-25euro. Also some hotels charge the driver a fee if they call a taxi for you, which the driver will usually pass onto you. Don't have the hotel call for you, just step out to the main st where there will be plenty of taxi going by. -Hotel does not have an elevator. Only a small spiralling staircase. It would be unsuitable for disabled people, but they happily assist those who need bags carried to the rooms. Overall a very nice budget hotel in a perfect area to see "old" Istanbul. I fell in love with Turkey on my visit which was unfortunately only 4 days long, so much that I'm planning a month long vacation for this summer.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic find”
Reviews.Author: Deborah_A
Reviews.Content: This is our first trip to Istanbul. Hotel Zeynep Sultan was in an excellent location, close to all the landmark buildings. The hotel was very clean and the staff friendly and helpful. Our only complaint was the room was very small and the bathroom small also, hey but this is old Istanbul. We should have asked for a larger room, but spent most of our time enjoying Istanbul anyway. The terrace on the roof for breakfast was fabulous with a view of Aya Sophia. Would stay again as proximity is excellent and within walking distance to all the famous landmarks in Old Istanbul, great restaurants and bars close by too. Free internet access at the hotel was also a bonus. Have recommended this hotel to family and friends since our stay here. Regards

Reviews.Title: “GReat little hotel”
Reviews.Author: LondonPaul
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a perfect location. The Manager picked us up from the airport and gave us a little tour of the area before showing us to our rooms...both very clean and comfy with fantastic power showers! Staff friendly and free internet. As has been said, the breakfast terrace is quite beautiful, but I was a little diasappointed with the fare...I had no idea what to expect, something a little more Western I suppose, but I am afraid I didnt leap out of bed each morning desperate for their olives and Nescafe! Was suprised there were no tea or coffee making facilities in the room. Still, would recommend this hotel to any first time visitor who likes comfort, convenience and friendliness from his or her hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: macrij
Reviews.Content: I had chosen this hotel after reading all of the great reviews online. I couldn't find a negative comment. I try and stay in four or five star hotels when I can afford them (or when I'm not paying the bill) but wanted to do this trip on the cheap. As far as comfort goes, this was as good as any four star. Room was clean, AC and heat both worked well, great shower pressure (my most important quality in a room) and as others have noted, the owner went above and beyond (including driving us to a tour in his car when it looked like we would be late). Only downside (for some, not me) is that the beds were a little hard. Not old or worn out, that was just the style of matress that they had. I would reccomend this and stay here again without hesitation. Location was excellent, close enough to walk to major sites, off the main route though so it was quiet.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect location”
Reviews.Author: GamboaWatchDog
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this remarkable hotel from Jan 9-13. The location was absolutely perfect within a very short walk to all of the major attractions in Sultanhamet. This hotel met all of our needs: no-smoking, clean (extremely), quiet - located on a very quiet street with no traffic, very friendly staff and management, free internet. The owner also gave us his personal cell phone number in case we ran into any problems or needed any help. We had our best nights sleep here in our travels.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in Instanbul”
Reviews.Author: Comment56
Reviews.Content: This is the place to stay in Istanbul. It is close to some of the major sites. The staff are extremely helpful and the rooms were clean. It was a challenge to find but well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Convienient, Clean and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Dzine
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel based upon the many enthusiastic reviews on Trip Advisor. The management and staff here have to live up to a lot of expectations based upon these reports and for the most part we were pleased and certainly have no regrets about our choice. I had scoffed at the reviews that mentioned the small rooms as I have stayed in many tiny rooms and rather enjoy compact hotel spaces. But on arrival I found that the reviews were right, the rooms here (at least our room) are indeed really small, a bit like a monk's cell, clean but mostly without space or charm. But this is Istanbul and who really wants to spend time in their room except to sleep. For us this wasn't a problem. The view from the roof is indeed nice. Visiting friends at other hotels we also saw equally spectacular vistas. It would be hard to dispute the friendlieness and helpfulness of the staff. They really are nice here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Lenita
Reviews.Content: I searched on internet and found this nice and cosy hotel. I have to admit it was the right choice. Location is excellent. Service is friendly. facilities are very good. The Overall experience was more than what we expected. The owner of the hotel is a very nice guy who even suggested to us where to eat and go in the city. I will suggest this hotel to anyone with no doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: Americanski
Reviews.Content: Our experience at the Zeynep Sultan was more than anything we could have expected... and make no mistake about it, we expected a lot from the previous reviews given. We stayed at this hotel for a duration of two weeks, so I believe our review is fair and justified. From the moment we were picked up at the airport to the very moment we departed, the staff of the hotel was always courteous, kind and charming. I have only experienced this kind of service once before from a 5 Star hotel -- so it was refreshing to say the least. The hotel itself is much like many others in the Sultanahmet District -- small, cozy and charming. Rooms are nicely air conditioned (individualy controlled with remote) and extremely clean. A TV is in the room with remote, mini-bar stocked with beverages and a dresser to hang your clothes in. Tile flooring lays upon the ground, so be sure to bring some slippers, as the floor can get cold at night. The bed is very comfortable -- nice firm mattress with heavy duty blankets. The window is a bit tricky to understand at first, as it opens in two different directions -- so make sure you ask how to open & close them properly. The Maid service is wonderful and they do a great job cleaning the rooms... so remember to leave them one Turkish Lire on the bed room because they work hard! I don't know what they used to clean the floors, but whatever it is, it always smelled wonderful whenever we came back into the room after they cleaned it. :-) There is also wireless internet connection throughout all of the hotel, including your room. If you cannot get it to work, just ask if they can reboot the main computer and this will fix the problem. But just remember -- the ADSL service in Turkey is not very good, so do not expect ADSL speeds you typically get from the US -- because that just ain't gonna happen! ;-) One of the nicest things about this hotel is the terrace. It overlooks St. Sophia, and I kid you not, Eli Manning could cold throw a football onto the roof if he were here. The photos I took do not begin to justify how close St. Sophia really is to the terrace! The terrace also has many plants and is decorated very nicely. Breakfast is served on the terrace everyday and is your typical Turkish breakfast with bread, some deli meat, olives, boiled eggs, hot water, nescafe coffee, pudding cakes and cereal with milk. While this breakfast might be considered "light" to many Westerners, I assure you, it's enough to begin your day and allow you to really feast on the finer Turkish foods throughout the rest of your day as you hit the streets viewing the sights. :-) Now, as for the staff, all I can say is "Wow!" They are great and go above and beyond the call of duty. You will not feel like a guest in a hotel here -- but more like a guest in their home. They are all kind, speak very good English and all of them are extremely charming. When we first arrived, I mentioned to Abraham that I wanted to eat pancakes and if he could recommend a place for us to eat at. He actually got a recipe from his girlfriend and made them for us! It was great! Seriously, they go out of their way to make sure you're happy. He also drove us around town to find us some manufacturers of leather goods -- all on his own time! I am still blown away by the wonderful service this charming little hotel has to offer! If you have any questions at all about where to go -- just ask them! If you want to go bowling -- just ask! Well, actually, you might want to scrap that idea, as the bowling alley here in Istanbul is terrible! (Ha!) The bottom line, when staying in Istanbul, you must ask yourself one thing... would you rather be close to everything and stay in a hotel that treats you like a guest in their home? Or would you rather stay in a hotel that treats you in accordance to the amount you had paid? You can pay $200 per night and still not get the service we got from the Zeynep Hotel... sure, you might get a larger room and larger bathroom... but for the extra $120 per night, you can see a lot more of Istanbul, gain 40 pounds from eating great food and allow the Turkish people to "Show you how to spend your money in their stores!" Think about it!!! ;-)

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: pri
Reviews.Content: I went to Zeynep Sultan Hotel in March this year with my family. We booked a room for three people. We received a room on ground floor which was rather small but nicely decorated and immaculately clean. It was still cold in March and we did have problems with the heating in the room at first. We called the staff to help us sort it out several times during the first few days who did finally managed to it on our day two. Our room window backed to another hotel and all we could see from it was another wall but the view from the rooftop terrace where we had breakfast in the morning was wonderfull. The breakfast itself was very nice too. My mother fell in love with their turkish coffee and we had to buy some for her to take home. Their honey, bread and olives stuffed with peppers are divine. I came to Istanbul with a very bad cough which I just could not shift but after couple of days there, it completely dissapeared. I am still convinced that this was something to do with consuming large quantities of honey there. The staff there were extremely friendly and helpfull. We also met the owner of the hotel Ibrahim who was kind enough to point us to some of the best attractions in the city. I did however find some of his comments a bit off putting. His comment to the prayer calls from the local mosques "Enough already" I found a bit disrespectfull. It was also contradictory as there is a chapel in the basement of the hotel. Another negative about the hotel was transport to the airport. From the airport we took a taxi which cost me approximately Â£10. Hotel's transport price to the airport was much more than that which I found quite unreasonable. We did not expect a free ride as we booked via Expedia but I did expect to pay around the same price as the local taxis. As far as Istanbul is concerned, ever since I came back , I have been talking about going back there. My family and I absolutely loved it. Staying in the Sultanahmet area felt like being transported back to the Ottoman period. The atmosphere in the city is amazing. Sitting in the garden in front of the Blue Mosque during lunch time prayer is very spiritually moving and enlightening. Views from the Topkapi palace are breathtaking. Do not miss the visit to the Spice Market as the prices there are generally lower than at the Grand Bazar and you get hassled less. I fell in love with the place and can not wait to go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “More than we expected”
Reviews.Author: Thaliana
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights in August, the night of our arrival and, after a 7 days tour around Turkey, 5 more nights. They kept part of our luggage during that interval of time, free of charge. They picked us up from the airport as we booked directly from the website and stayed more than 3 days. We felt welcomed since the first minute. The hotel was really quite and, after a long sightseeing, it was really nice to have a rest in the reception talking to the friendly staff and playing with the lazy cat. Stuff were really helpful, making good suggestions when asked. Everyone we met was kind with us, even our english was poor and sometimes it was difficult to understand us! They didn't hesitate to repeat every answer twice. We felt at home. Everything is close to the hotel, as you can read in other reviews. The location is excelent. Our room was not small, as it had an extra bed where we placed our luggage (we payed for a twin room). But even without this extra bed, I would have considered the room as good sized. I suppose that it depends on your standards. For me, and for the price I payed, a room with a wardrobe, a table to place the luggage, a TV and a large bed (and the bed was one of the most comfortable I have ever found in a hotel) is ok. I just heard the call to pray the first night (maybe I was so tired -and the bed was so comfortable- that I didn't hear anything the rest of nights!). The room and bathroom were spotless and the air conditioning worked perfectly (without noise). We could watch the spanish international channel, something we had not found in other hotels, and was nice to see the news in our mother tongue, as our english is poor. You also have free internet connection. The only thing they could improve is perhaps the breakfast, very simple and unvariable, maybe ok if you stay one or two days, but a bit boring and simple if you stay for long. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: LHRTripper
Reviews.Content: The Zeynep Sultan is a great basic hotel for a sightseeing trip to Istanbul. It is situated in the heart of Sultanahmet under the shadow of the Aya Sofia and just around the corner from the Blue Mosque. The rooms are on the small side but very clean and well appointed. The bathroom was also small but very efficiently filled, but most importantly the shower was excellent; really refreshing after a night partying in Taksim. Breakfast is basic but fresh bread, eggs cheese and honey are all you need to set you up for a trek around the sights. We were most impressed by the staff. They were extremely friendly and helpful. We felt very welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DesertDarling
Reviews.Content: Zeynep Sultan is an easy walk to historical monuments, restaurants, train station, and markets. The staff was so helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: cinnamon75
Reviews.Content: Booked the Zeynep Sultan for a week-long stay after reading reviews on this site.
