I agree with most other visitors that the location is excellent (quiet-ish side street smack bang in the middle of Sultanahmet) and the personnel most friendly. The owner made a real point of mingling with the guests at breakfast and gave useful tips on how to organise your own outings rather than joining the organised cattle herds. The outside tables on the roof terrace are hugely popular with all breakfast guests but even when they're all taken, no problem - the guys will carry another table out for you! The room I stayed in was relatively small (that was fine as I was by myself), clean, air-conditioned and in a good state of repair. The bathroom was also small but plumbing worked perfectly (more than can be said of most British hotels!!!). Only minus point was the rather variable standard of cleaning. Towels weren't changed automatically (I guess you have to ask). Tip: do take some earplugs, as the hotel is right next to the Zeynep Sultan Mosque - calls to prayer start at 5.30am sharp! Overall I would say really good value for money, if you're after a comfortable, affordable base to explore the city (I booked through hoteldiscount.com), rather than a hotel to lounge around in (no restaurant / bar).

Reviews.Title: “Great position, exceptionally helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Lizlovestotravel
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed for 5 days, wonderful position, 5 minutes walk from the Blue Mosque, Haghia Sophia and many other interesting places. Rooms were reasonable size, bathroom a little small but we don't (we hope!) spend a lot of time in a bathroom on holiday. Everything spotlessly clean. We were in Room 304, with a very restful view of trees and a distant minaret, quiet as away from road and if you put your head out of the window, fab views of next door mosque (take earplugs unless you are an early riser) and Haghia Sophia. Breakfast adequate, extra for fresh orange juice & also water, thought water at least should have been foc. Would have been nice if some fruit & yogurt had been included but OK and great views over the city. Owner and staff exceptionally friendly and helpful, owner taking trouble to help us plan our day, even advising getting municipal ferry up the Bosphorus rather than more expensive option, and always around if needed. All staff very helpful but not in a servile way, interesting people to talk to. 100% recommended, everywhere clean and you feel that they really want you to enjoy your stay and their city. Resident cat also welcoming!

Reviews.Title: “Most Satisfactory”
Reviews.Author: CanadianBoys
Reviews.Content: We are just back from Istanbul having stayed 6 nights at the Zeynep Sultyan Hotel from 26th August - 01 September. Two weeks before arrival we reconfirmed our booking and were advised we could only get the twin room for 5 nights - and asked us nicely if we would agree to a 6th night at the neighbouring AND hotel - offering us complimentary pick up service (we did not book directly so were not entitled to it). We accepted - and upon arrival at Ataturk Airport, our driver was there to greet us upon (our late) arrival with a smile - a very nice man. On checking in we were advised that all nights would be at the Zeynep Sultan Hotel and once we saw our oom we were glad!. We booked a "grande" twin room on Venere for 6 nights. The room was large not grande - but not a problem. The hotel itself rates **+ , possibly *** by North American standards. The hotel offers limited amenities, these being the large breakfast room with terrace (think Super 8 but better and much cleaner) and free access to the Internet station. It is a new hotel 2 years old we were told - and looks it - in great shape. Our 3rd floor room, and the entire hotel is simply spotless - and in Istanbul this reason alone is good enough to stay here. Safety devices abound - with fire/smoke and security cameras every where - you are in good hands in this place. Our twin room had a 3rd bed that held our luggage and a small but adequate bathroom with shower. We looked at other rooms when they were being cleaned - and the hotels website portrays all rooms exactly as you will get them (no need for my pics to be posted here). The airconditioning worked VERY well - as did the TV, lighting etc. Very high tech systems. Bathroom was spotless, so much so I looked for mildew and found none, wondering how they could keep them so clean until I heard the cleaning lady one morning with her nose to the grind. Breakfast on the lovely terrace is typically Turkish - simple, light and adequate. Need a mid morning snack? Lots of great places for that!! The view from the breakfast terrace with the Zynep Sultan Mosque (from which the hotel gets its name next door) against the larger Hagia Sophia is particularly breathtaking. Service at the hotel was better than "average". We had laundry done, asked for restaurant recommendations etc. We also had the driver take us back to the airport at the exact time we wanted and we paid 20 Euros for that convenience and since we now had 5 large suitcases it was convenient to be dropped off at the right terminal door. The Owner was polite and tactful in approaching guests (my observation). Some guests seem to prefer to chat up the staff and Owner - while others like us are quiet and private. The Owner and staff are avialable to chat - you just need to make the effort to engage them - otherwise they remain respectfully aloof. At all times we were greeted with "hellos" and "good mornings" etc. As for the location - it is better than good - it is the best - bar none. The tram at Gulane Tram Station is 125 feet away - and takes you accross the Galata Bridge to the last stop on the tramline to directly connect on the funicular to Taksim Square. We used it every night! As for the Tokapi Palace and Hagia Sophia and Blue Mosque - they are accross the street - no other hotel offers such convenience. Would we stay here again? In a heartbeat. If the hotel Owner is reading this - I would recommend you host a Raki Cocktail hour (1 complimentary drink) so guests can greet and meet on the great terrace in the early evenings before they go out dinner - & leran about Raki. The terrace is a great place and a cocktail hour may help create the "boutique hotel" feel. Pros: 1. great location to historic sites & tram to Taksim Square 2. clean (spotless) comfortable rooms, great beds and linens 3. great breakfast terrace, light but adequate breakfast, sit back and enjoy and evening drink before going out for dinner 4. Hotel staff and Owner fully fluent in English - eliminating any barriers in communications Cons: 1. no elevator (but great steps so no problem) 2. facecloths in bathroom would be nice 3. rotation of meat types, and breads at breakfast for guests staying longer than 3 days (not a biggie though)

Reviews.Title: “Super location, service, and human contact.”
Reviews.Author: Yiannis47
Reviews.Content: 03/Sep/06 From Athens Greece -Yiannis and Catriona. I booked this hotel after reading the reviews in this site. We stayed for 6 nights, the last week of July after booking for 4 nights and if there had been rooms available we would stay longer. Next time for sure. I dont want to repeat all the positive coments that are mentioned in other reviews, you allready may have formed an opinion by reading those. For me and my wife, above the location the good service and the clean rooms wich were the reasons that we chose that hotel, is the human face of the staff and the hotel owner. Proffessionals they are, but there is something more that you don't get nomatter how much you pay. And this is the human contact, the talking with Ibrahim durind beakfast, the invaluable information about where to go and what to eat. It was like we where among our friends. All this and much more gave us another perspective to this amazing metropolis. Without this we would not experience the smells the tasts and the views as much and our opinion about Istanbul woul definatly be pourer. Thanks for everything, we'll come again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Zeynep Sultan”
Reviews.Author: TarkanFan
Reviews.Content: I can't believe some of the negative reviews on this hotel, for example "voice of dissent" , "abysmal" and others. Are we referring to the same hotel? I stayed at the Zeynep Sultan in April 2006 with my family and we had an excellent time. It was exactly what I expected, having research various hotels before booking. The hotel is ideally situated close to all the sights in Sultanahmet. The staff were very friendly. The owner couldnt have been more helpful with regards to sightseeing and places to eat. We were immediately made to feel welcome on arrival and throughout the stay. The rooms are fairly small but have everything you need - and what do you need space for? We were out sightseeing most of the time. The hotel is spotlessly clean. There was free use of the internet. The breakfast was a typical Turkish breakfast like you would get in most traditional Turkish hotels. The views from the terrace were wonderful - overlooking the Aghia Sofia Mosque, Topkapi Park (where you could see storks flying around), and right next to the Zeynep Sultan mosque. The prayer call was amazing! The cystern, Topkapi Park, Aghia Sofia Mosque were all a two minute walk away. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to stay in a small friendly Turkish Hotel. If you want five star Luxury and uniformed staff go somewhere like the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Just Right for the Money”
Reviews.Author: 2-lawyers
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Zeynep Sultan before heading off to a month long stint at Bosphorus University. Last year, my husband and I stayed there while we were in Istanbul on vacation. We loved it then and I was pleased when I returned as a single female traveler. While Abe's (the owner) hospitality greatly added to our experience last year, he was not there when I stayed there this year. However, even in his absence, the staff was friendly, efficient and helpful. I was quite ill when I arrived (having gotten sick on the plane) and the staff went out of their way to help me get settled in, even going so far as to bring dinner in for me so I would not have to go out. They also arranged transportation for me to get to Bosphorus University in Etiler. Furthermore, they remembered me from the year before and greeted me warmly. I was especially happy to see Duran as he is a shining example of Turkish hospitality as are the rest of the staff. Yes, the rooms are small, but so are most rooms in this price range, but they are immaculately clean and the location cannot be beat. Breakfast is not a full American breakfast or an elaborate buffet, but rather a Turkish breakfast. It is important to remember that most Turks just grab a pastry and some coffee or tea for breakfast and head off to work. The hotel provides an excellent value for the money with no unpleasant surprises. However, if you want huge rooms and luxury amenities like those offered by the Four Seasons, you should expect to pay for them. Generally speaking, you get what you pay for and it is my opinion that the Zeynep delivers a strong value for your money. Thank you Zeynep staff for making my stay enjoyable and for being so helpful!! Brandi Yergeau

Reviews.Title: “Abysmal”
Reviews.Author: BernieLomax
Reviews.Content: Firstly let me say that I have waited over one month to write this review purely because I wanted to provide as an unbiased review as possible which was (at least to a large extent) free from the anger and disgust which I felt following our stay at this hotel. Having said this, whenever I recall our stay at the Zeynep Sultan unfortunately all of those strong emotions come flooding back. Therefore in an in order not to cloud my review with these emotions I will merely summarize our experience with a view to allowing anyone reading this to make the most informed decision possible regarding this hotel. Our experiences in chronological order were as follows: 1. We were allocated a twin room (on the basis that all double rooms were apparently full) despite booking a double room over one month in advance; 2. The room we were allocated was so small that there was barely any floor space around the beds; 3. The 'breakfast' if you can even call it that consisted of little more than bread and two different varieties of cured meats - juice and water were provided upon request but at additional cost; 4. After returning to our room from doing some sightseeing on the second day and discovering that the room had been made up despite us having left the 'Do not disturb' sign on the door we were shocked to find that a strap on one of our bags had been completely torn away (we can only assume by the cleaning staff). Upon raising this issue with the Manager he stated that 'this was not possible' (a position that was later reitterated by the owner)and that it was in fact his word against ours; 5. Despite the fact that the package we booked for this hotel included a free transfer to the airport the Manager informed us that since our booking the hotel's policy had changed and that free transfers were only provided to guests staying for three nights or more (we stayed for two). Whilst admittedly fairly clean and in a reasonably good location, I would never stay at this hotel again, and would not recommend it to anyone - unless of course extremely small rooms, extremely rude staff and extremely bad breakfasts are what you enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed experience”
Reviews.Author: Iss
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Zeynep Sultan in July after reading the wonderful reviews in Tripadvisor and had a somewhat mixed experience. I think that something to bear in mind is that it is a 2 to 2Â½ star establishment which is not always clear, given the reviews and the position in tripadvisor (number 2 at the time we booked). Pros: -This hotel has character and is in a superb location within walking distance of all the main sights in the historical centre. -The room and the bathroom were very clean. -The room had some nice touches. -The young men at reception were extremely warm, friendly and helpful. Cons: - The room is very small, as is the bathroom. We were made to understand that we had one of the bigger rooms, so I imagine that the smaller ones could be very cramped. We specifically booked a La Grande Deluxe room through Venere so were somewhat disappointed. - The hospitality and friendliness of the owner is something that comes across quite strongly in most of the reviews. Our experience of this was quite different. We were booked in for a 6 night stay, and despite initiating conversation with the owner on 2 occasions, he never remembered us, nor greeted or talked to us in the same manner as he did with the other, predominantly American and European guests. We felt quite disheartened by this attitude. On the last two days of the holiday, after my husband spent time watching a football match with him and chatted to him, he warmed up and was friendly. However, overall I felt that we were in fact treated differently from the other customers, and felt that our race was key. I understand that different guests have different experience, but this was our experience. - The breakfast was very very basic, with no complimentary drinks other than tea or coffee, not even water or juice. - We had read on the website that the hotel offered a cash discount which we confirmed on arrival. On leaving we were told that this did not apply to us as we had not booked through the hotel directly. This was fine in itself, but created a logistical problem as we had gotten rid of our Turkish lira apart from the anticipated total. When paying we were a 3 lira short. We had stayed for a week, and this represented a miniscule amount of the total bill. The night manager insisted that the only option was for us to pay the difference in Euros which would have resulted in us receiving a massive amount of lira in change. Eventually we opted to put the additional amount on our credit card. In conclusion, the hotel is convenient and clean and represents good value for money if you have the correct expectations. However, if you are not white, do not expect the same level of interaction and attention that the other reviews have you believe. Tip: Book through the hotel website rather than an online agent for the following reasons. 1.10% cash discount 2.Venere has 3 categories of rooms, but Iâ€™m not sure that it makes that much of a difference in reality. 3.If you book through the website you get a free airport transfer

Reviews.Title: “Everything is tiny! Room, Toilet, Breakfast, Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Zeynep hotel was our third hotel in Istanbul. We moved to Zeynep from Taksim, after attending the academic conference in Taksim, Istanbul. We went through the hotels in istanbul that the hotels in Sultanemet are cheaper than in Taksim, so we thought we chose Zeynep which is similar price with the hotel we stayed in Taksim and also expected similiar facilities. When we first went into our rooms which were on the ground floor, we were shocked that the room was so tiny(I never saw a television setting like a overhead projector in a 'hotel'!) and the toilet were same size as a closet! I believe a 200lb men cannot go into the shower room! On the other hand, there were not enough food to be selected and the size of each selection was not enough to feed 10 guests. Thus, we had to have breakfast on or before 8:45am, otherwise I think we could only get the boiled egg!!! Originally we booked a room for 4 nights. Under such conditions of the hotel, we requested to cancel the last 2 night reservation. When we talked to the hotel manager (I don't know his name) to cancel the last 2 nights in Zeynep. He was so rude to us and ingore us to keep on eating his brunch! Then he said 'We have our own reservation policy and this is EUROPE, NOT CHINA! I've got your credit card no. I can even charge you for 4 nights, up to your decision!', then he left! He words were full of discrimination! We just wanted to express our concern to him and his attitude was so.......disgusting! Finally, we left Zeynep and move to stay another hotel in Sultanemet. We felt we were free. Cheaper price, bigger room (a double room with 1 twin bed & 1 single bed and hugh space for putting our stuff), perfect hospitality, breakfast with more selections. I won't recommend Zepnep to all Asian and budgeted travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just back from a week in Istanbul, stayed at the Zeynap Sultan hotel, excellent location, walking distance from everything, the mosque, restraunts, grand bazaar, sea side. Hotel was clean and comfortable. I chose this hotel based on reviews but in my 5 days stay i never once met the owner which others have highly spoken about. Recommend this hotel, only down fall was breakfast as very boring, there was not much to eat and you had to pay for water and orange juice. There was not much of a selection of the breakfast contents. Feel free to contact me if you want first hand experiance of Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “An Award Winner!”
Reviews.Author: grriz
Reviews.Content: If Istanbul had a Tourism of the Year Award, it should be given to the Hotel Sultan Zeynap and to the owner Ibraham and his amazing staff. Safe, Clean, Convenient, Friendly, Quiet and Comfortable are just the beginning adjectives. Here you are not just a room number, but more of an invited guest. Not a tourist, but a traveler. We spent four and a half glorious days discovering the city and the whole adventure was made sweeter by the time spent visiting with Ibraham and his nephew and staff. History and politics of the city, local customs, restaurants and must-do tours were all discussed at breakfast on the terrace each morning. Where to go, how to get there, "wait a second, I'll show you," "let me get you a taxi," "when you are at the Topaki Palace, have lunch in its reastaurant. It's touristy, but the view is great and you are already there." It would be easy to continue singing the praises of this hotel, but why go on, I think you have the picture. Why would anyone want to stay anywhere else. Thanks Ibrahim. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: Tmrmwel
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay in Istanbul, and we picked Zeynep Sultan Hotel by recommendation from Trip Advisor - we were not disappointed! The hotel has a near perfect location, in walking distance from all of the sights in Sultanahmet and the Bazaar district, and with easy access to taxis, trams and boats to get around all Istanbul and Bosphorus. In addition the staff is very friendly, and very helpful towards any questions you may have. The rooms are not big, but with more than enough room to be able to relax there after a long day of sightseeing. The standard is high; very clean rooms with TV, mini bar and air condition, there is free internet access and safe at your disposal, and the terrace on the roof is nice both for breakfast and for relaxing in the afternoon. All in all we had a brilliant holiday in Istanbul, much thanks to our nice stay at Zeynep Sultan!

Reviews.Title: “Right place, right price, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: JM47York
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a splendid four night stay in this lovely city. We found this hotel through Trip Advisor and booked it as a result of the reviews. The owner, Ibrahim, his staff and hotel, more than live up to all that has been said in the other reviews. The location is ideal for the old city sights with Topkapi, St Sophia and the Blue Mosque in the immediate vicinity and the Grand Bazaar and Ferry Terminals a short walk away. The rooms are ideal for a short break, the breakfast sets one up for the day and is taken on a roof restaurant/balcony overlooking St Sophia, while Ibrahim and his team readily dispense excellent and helpful itinerary and directional advice. The customer care is superb and included, in our case, a member of staff walking us to the ferry to ensure we got on the correct boat for the Bosphorous cruise and unsolicited coffee and cake at 0500 prior to a very early departure. We are extremely satisfied customers who hope to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Best value, clean and personable”
Reviews.Author: zeusreign
Reviews.Content: I would agree with everything said. Simple but very clean and convenient. Free internet access too. My single room was smaller than my master bathroom at home but it was fine. The call to prayer was the only inconvenience that I can think of. The terrace views were great and the Owner always had good and honest suggestions of where to go for food, etc. If you get tired of the mosques go to Fener for Sunday Christian service. We were there when the Patriarch or the Orthodox church was there and not out visiting some other country and it was great. The Owner even gave us a ride. Very Nice!! Tell the Owner that Tom from Denver sent you!

HotelInfo.Name: Zeynep Sultan Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Zeynep Sultan Camii Sok 25 Sultanahmet, Istanbul 34140, Turkey
